channel.title: Spam bots?
channel.description:
Mopar has always (and still is) doing an excellent job with fighting off spam bots. Recently though I have been seeing a few getting past the set security. This has been an on going thing I have noticed for a good week or so.
Does Tom/MITB know yet what is causing these bots to get in? Maybe some sort of new anti bot security needs to be designed/implemented.
Edit: before it is said... I am not knowledgeable on how security systems work for forums so I can't even start to fathom what can be done to help prevent these occurrences. Perhaps some of them site developer ranks can help put in some positive feedback? ;)

@arham_4 wrote:

Seen this getting abused too much in the server status section, not in the forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Spam bots?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

Phaze One:

As said by Newty, most spam threads are sent to a spam archive by a script that moparisthebest wrote to catch key words from first time posters (links mostly iirc). I don’t really see a suggestion here this easily could’ve been messaged to one of the mods or admins.

how am I going to suggest what I don’t know about? I clearly stated:

before it is said... I am not knowledgeable on how security systems work for forums so I can't even start to fathom what can be done to help prevent these occurrences. Perhaps some of them site developer ranks can help put in some positive feedback?

Read full topic

item.title: Spam bots?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:6, topic:528195”]It wouldn’t be hard at all to implement the http://stopforumspam.com/ API in order to just stop them registering in the first place. But then we’re just going to be told that the “rewrite” that’s been in progress for years now still needs to happen[/quote]yeah and there is something called a honeypot or something like that also?

Read full topic

item.title: Spam bots?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

It wouldn’t be hard at all to implement the http://stopforumspam.com/ API in order to just stop them registering in the first place. But then we’re just going to be told that the “rewrite” that’s been in progress for years now still needs to happen

Read full topic

item.title: Spam bots?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Most things are caught and sent to a ‘spam’ board that is hidden from everyone but global mods and up (afaik).

Whatever isn’t caught is normally dealt with manually but if we don’t catch it then feel free to report it or send one of us a PM.

Read full topic

item.title: Spam bots?

item.description:
